Last night, I dropped by my friend Ellen‚Äôs house for a little duet‚Ä¶

Ellen: Michelle Obama has a new book‚Ä¶
Michelle Obama: It‚Äôs actually a Journal!
Ellen: What‚Äôs it called?
Michelle Obama: It‚Äôs the Becoming Journal. [Ellen: The Becoming Journal‚Ä¶] The purpose of the Journal is to write down your own story of Becoming‚Ä¶.to chronicle your memories, your thoughts, your ideas, your impressions‚Ä¶because every story matters. Even yours, Ellen.
Ellen: Even mine‚Ä¶
Michelle Obama: What is your story?
Ellen: What is my story?
Together: What is my story?
Michelle Obama: Who are you Becoming?

So thrilled to receive a #GRAMMYs nomination! This past year has been such a meaningful, exhilarating ride. I‚Äôve loved hearing your stories and continuing down the road of becoming together. Thank you for every ounce of love and support you‚Äôve shared so generously. #IAmBecoming ‚Ä¨

@oprah has been there for me in so many ways for so many years‚Äîsince before my husband was even elected to the U.S. Senate. Can‚Äôt wait to return the favor and join her and @ww.now in Brooklyn for #oprahs2020visiontour!

Today I stopped by @politicsprose, a local bookstore here in DC, to celebrate the one-year anniversary of Becoming. It‚Äôs hard to believe that it‚Äôs already been a year since I shared my story with the world. Since the #IAmBecoming tour came to a close, I found myself reflecting on many of the conversations I had with so many of you‚Äîfrom the book clubs and community groups I visited to all the thoughtful comments and conversations we had online. I noticed so many of us face a common challenge‚Äîthat no matter who we are or where we come from, too often, we convince ourselves that our stories don‚Äôt matter.‚ÄØ‚ÄØSo, as we approach a New Year, I wanted to find a way to help us all embrace our own stories. That‚Äôs what the Becoming Journal is all about‚Äîreflecting on our lives, especially the tiniest details. That‚Äôs how we can keep becoming‚Äîby seeing our stories for the powerful truths that they are, and then, by reaching out to each other and embracing all the vulnerability, the wisdom, and the twists and turns that both make our journeys so unique‚Äîand bind us together so tightly. I‚Äôm so excited to share the journal with you. Starting tomorrow, you can get your own copy at becomingmichelleobama.com.

So proud to present my friend Lin-Manuel Miranda with the Portrait of a Nation Prize at the National Portrait Gallery. I first met Lin more than a decade ago, when he came to the White House to perform the opening number from what he described as a ‚Äúconcept album.‚Äù And, as we all know, his little concept, Hamilton, became a global phenomenon. But what I love most is that he believes it‚Äôs his duty to lift up those around him, especially the next generation. It‚Äôs why he‚Äôs created a Hamilton curriculum for schools, made sure kids from all over can see his shows, and raised millions of dollars for Puerto Rico after Hurricane Maria. And it‚Äôs why he is working so hard to make sure folks are voting in every election and using that freedom that so many fought so hard for. He‚Äôs someone who has, in melody and rhyme and connection, painted as honest a portrait of our country as I‚Äôve ever seen. Love this guy.

Whenever I'm looking for a source of strength and courage, I think about our veterans and their families‚Äîthey inspire me every day. On #VeteransDay, let's make sure we all give a little something back to those who have given so much to our nation.
The best person to register voters in your community is you. I've got my #VotingSquad together‚Äînow we need you! Get started at whenweallvote.org. @whenweallvote

With less than a year to the 2020 elections, it's time to start thinking about your #VotingSquad. I‚Äôve got mine: Shonda. Liza. Selena. Tom. Lin-Manuel. Tracee. Faith. Kerry. Chris. Janelle. Megan. Rita. Join us at whenweallvote.org and learn how you can get involved. @whenweallvote

Craig knew me as Miche long before the world knew me as Michelle Obama. Today at the #ObamaSummit alongside journalist Isabel Wilkerson, we shared our memories of Chicago, the place that made us who we are. Another special memory to share with my brother in our hometown.

Throughout my years in the White House, I spent a lot of time with our nation‚Äôs military caregivers. They‚Äôre the people‚Äîspouses, parents, siblings, children, and many others‚Äîwho give so much to care for loved ones who‚Äôve been wounded in service to our country. I can‚Äôt tell you how powerful their stories are‚Äîthese women and men fundamentally changed me. They changed the way I see service and the way I see this country. They‚Äôre folks who upend their lives, putting careers on hold and moving across the country. They‚Äôre taking on the responsibilities of entire households while learning to care for physical and emotional needs in a new way. They‚Äôre simply incredible, and over these past few years, my hope was to help give a little something back to those who‚Äôve given our country so much. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm so thankful for the work that the @elizabethdolefoundation does every day to celebrate and support our nation‚Äôs caregivers‚Äîand it‚Äôs why I hope you‚Äôll find a way to do the same in your community.
It doesn‚Äôt always feel good in the moment. But after the fact, I‚Äôm always glad I hit the gym. How did you all take care of yourself on this #SelfCareSunday? üí™üèæ

Leading up to tomorrow‚Äôs #DayOfTheGirl, I've been thinking about how, from a young age, girls are often shushed when they speak up, or they‚Äôre set aside, as if in a delicate box so they don‚Äôt break. These patterns, which begin in our earliest years, don‚Äôt just affect us as girls‚Äîthey shape who we become as women. I thought about this last week, when I spoke with these incredible young ladies in Dallas, who told me about the obstacles they‚Äôve overcome. For them and so many others, it can be difficult to open up and share your story if you‚Äôre not confident that people will accept you for who you are. Their stories moved me to keep finding new ways to make sure that every girl and young woman has the support‚Äîand the confidence‚Äîto recognize that her story matters. So I wanted to ask you today: Who in your life showed you that you were valued when you were younger? And how do you show the girls in your life today that they‚Äôre valued?

27 years ago, this guy promised me a life full of adventure. I‚Äôd say he‚Äôs delivered. Here‚Äôs to our next chapter of becoming empty nesters and discovering what‚Äôs next‚Äîwhile still feeling the magic that brought us together all those years ago. Happy anniversary, Barack. üíï
